item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, April 8, 2025 at 1:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. LLM-hacker-news: LLM plugin for pulling content from Hacker News (46 points | 20 comments)
2. Middle-aged man trading cards go viral in rural Japan town (1226 points | 292 comments)
3. Show HN: Connecting an IBM 3151 terminal to a mainframe [video] (5 points | 1 comment)
4. No elephants: Breakthroughs in image generation (143 points | 82 comments)
5. Intelligence Evolved at Least Twice in Vertebrate Animals (50 points | 17 comments)
6. Any program can be a GitHub Actions shell (202 points | 57 comments)
7. Building the System/360 Mainframe Nearly Destroyed IBM (56 points | 14 comments)
8. Brazil's government-run payments system has become dominant (153 points | 182 comments)
9. Hyundai to buy 'thousands' of Boston Dynamics robots (9 points | discuss)
10. Show HN: Browser MCP – Automate your browser using Cursor, Claude, VS Code (500 points | 182 comments)
11. Cloudflare Acquires Outerbase (30 points | 2 comments)
12. Deleting multiplayer from the Unreal engine can save memory (100 points | 26 comments)
13. Neural Graffiti – Liquid Memory Layer for LLMs (42 points | 10 comments)
14. An Overwhelmingly Negative and Demoralizing Force (58 points | 9 comments)
15. Show HN: Lux – A luxurious package manager for Lua (232 points | 85 comments)
16. Paradigm (YC W24) Hiring Founding Engineers in SF ( | hide)
17. What a refugee camp reveals about economics (16 points | 5 comments)
18. A wild 'freakosystem' has been born in Hawaii (47 points | 48 comments)
19. Ancient Dagger Up to 2.5k Years Old W Stars/Moons/Geometric Patterns Unearthed (91 points | 25 comments)
20. India's repair culture gives new life to dead laptops (200 points | 115 comments)
21. Unmasking EncryptHub: Help from ChatGPT and Opsec Blunders (47 points | 12 comments)
22. Arbitrage and equilibrium in the Team Fortress 2 economy (2012) (8 points | 2 comments)
23. A Supermarket Bag and a Truckload of FOMO (91 points | 45 comments)
24. Fifty Years of Open Source Software Supply Chain Security (154 points | 62 comments)
25. 'Exploding' Tunnock's teacakes cleared by tests to fly again (57 points | 24 comments)
26. Interviewing a software engineer who prepared with AI (247 points | 401 comments)
27. Scaffold Level Editor (113 points | 23 comments)
28. Decoding the 90s: Cryptography in Early Software Development (2023) (118 points | 37 comments)
29. Pebbles Form Planets (16 points | 1 comment)
30. Tom and Jerry One-Minute Video Generation with Test-Time Training (41 points | 3 comments)
